subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: how to transcribe air and ear
msgSnippet: ... *sigh* I m using SAMPA, as I said, to represent IPA; you re using Kirshenbaum, as you have not said but I can deduce.  We mean the same thing. -- May the
messageBody:
paulhtremblay scripsit:

> Therefore maybe you want to first propose a guide. #32 should be /A/,
> according to John Cowan. He has #33 as /O/, and has #34 as /A./ (He
> actually has /Q/ for #34, but he describes it as /A./ /Q/ would
> something absolutely entirely different, so I think he meant /A./).

*sigh*

I'm using SAMPA, as I said, to represent IPA; you're using Kirshenbaum,
as you have not said but I can deduce. We mean the same thing.

--
May the hair on your toes never fall out! John Cowan
--Thorin Oakenshield (to Bilbo) cowan@...
